data.chText: 公平的；合理的；有理由的；明智的
data.enText: fair, practical and sensible

data.chText: 有理由认为他事先就知道会发生这样的事。
data.enText: It is reasonable to assume that he knew beforehand that this would happen.

data.chText: 要讲道理呀！我们不能每天晚上都加班到很晚呀。
data.enText: Be reasonable! We can't work late every night.

data.chText: 任何有头脑的人都会完全照你那样去做的。
data.enText: Any reasonable person would have done exactly as you did.

data.chText: 控方必须毫无疑义地证明他犯有谋杀罪。
data.enText: The prosecution has to prove beyond reasonable doubt that he is guilty of murder.

data.chText: 可以接受的；合乎情理的；公道的
data.enText: acceptable and appropriate in a particular situation

data.chText: 他给我们出的车价公平合理。
data.enText: He made us a reasonable offer for the car.

data.chText: 你必须在适当的时间内提出要求。
data.enText: You must submit your claim within a reasonable time.

data.chText: 不太贵的；公道的
data.enText: not too expensive

data.chText: 我们以公道的价格出售优质食品。
data.enText: We sell good quality food at reasonable prices.

data.chText: 不错的；还算好的；过得去的
data.enText: fairly good, but not very good

data.chText: 还算不错的生活水平
data.enText: a reasonable standard of living

data.chText: 我觉得这家酒店还可以。
data.enText: The hotel was reasonable, I suppose (= but not excellent) .

data.text: cheap ♦ competitive ♦ budget ♦ affordable ♦ reasonable ♦ inexpensive

data.chText: 以上各词均指产品或服务花钱少或低于预期。
data.enText: These words all describe a product or service that costs little money or less money than you expected.
cheap

data.chText: 指花钱少、便宜、收费低廉。
data.enText: costing little money or less money than you expected; charging low prices

data.chText: cheap亦可作贬义，指价低质劣：
data.enText: Cheap can also be used in a disapproving way to suggest that sth is poor quality as well as low in price.

data.chText: 一瓶低价劣质香水
data.enText: a bottle of cheap perfume
competitive

data.chText: 指价格、产品或服务收费方面具有竞争力
data.enText: (of prices, goods or services) as cheap as or cheaper than those offered by other companies; able to offer goods or services at competitive prices
budget

data.chText: （尤用于广告）指仅提供基本服务因而价格低廉
data.enText: [only before noun] (used especially in advertising) cheap because it offers only a basic level of service
affordable

data.chText: 指多数人买得起或负担得来的
data.enText: cheap enough for most people to afford
reasonable

data.chText: 指价格不太高、公道的
data.enText: (of prices) not too expensive
inexpensive

data.chText: 指不昂贵。
data.enText: ( rather formal ) cheap

data.chText: inexpensive常含就价格而言合算之意，有时用以代替cheap，因为cheap可有质量低劣的含义。
data.enText: Inexpensive is often used to mean that sth is good value for its price. It is sometimes used instead of cheap , because cheap can suggest that sth is poor quality.
cheap/competitive/budget/affordable/reasonable prices/fares/rates
cheap/competitive/budget/affordable/inexpensive goods/products/services
to be/become/seem/sound cheap/competitive/affordable/reasonable/inexpensive
quite/relatively/extremely/very cheap/competitive/affordable/reasonable/inexpensive

ex.chText: 项目负责人需要充分了解之后才可以作出合理的决定。
ex.enText: The project leader needs to be fully informed so he can make a rational decision.

ex.chText: 他说的话听起来像是合理的解释。
ex.enText: What he said sounds like a rational explanation.

ex.chText: 她现在看上去更加理智了。

synonyms.bx: 指想法、决定等基于理性判断的，也指人能冷静思考的。

ex.chText: 合情合理的请求是不会被拒绝的。
ex.enText: Reasonable requests won't be turned down.

ex.chText: 你不认为这个问题问得很有道理吗？
ex.enText: Don't you think it is a perfectly reasonable question?

ex.chText: 她给我们开出的房价公平合理。
ex.enText: She made us a reasonable offer for the house.

synonyms.bx: 指说法、请求、问题、报价等合情合理的，侧重公平性和合理性。

ex.chText: 我需要的是合理的建议而不是无用的抱怨。
ex.enText: What I need is sensible advice rather than useless complaints.

ex.chText: 和室友保持良好关系是明智的。
ex.enText: It is sensible to keep a good relationship with your roommates.

synonyms.bx: 指人及行为合理、务实且表现出良好判断力的。

value.def: If you think that someone is fair and sensible you can say that they are reasonable.

example.ex: He's a reasonable sort of chap...

value.tran: （人）公平的，明智的，理智的，有判断力的

example.tran: “我很抱歉，安德鲁，”她很懂事地说道。

example.ex: 'I can understand how you feel,' Desmond said with great reasonableness.
example.tran: “我能理解你的感受，”德斯蒙德很通情达理地说。

value.def: If you say that a decision or action is reasonable, you mean that it is fair and sensible.

example.ex: At the time, what he'd done had seemed reasonable.
example.tran: 那时他的所作所为似乎很合理。

value.def: If you say that an expectation or explanation is reasonable, you mean that there are good reasons why it may be correct.

example.ex: It seems reasonable to expect rapid urban growth.
example.tran: 似乎有理由期望城市快速发展。

value.tran: （期望或解释）合理的，有道理的

example.ex: You can reasonably expect your goods to arrive within six to eight weeks.
example.tran: 你有理由预期自己的货物会在6到8周内到达。

value.def: If you say that the price of something is reasonable, you mean that it is fair and not too high.

example.ex: You get an interesting meal for a reasonable price...
example.tran: 你花不多的钱就可以吃一顿很特别的饭。

value.tran: （价钱）合理的，公道的，不太贵的

value.def: You can use reasonable to describe something that is fairly good, but not very good.

example.ex: The boy answered him in reasonable French...
example.tran: 这个男孩用还算流利的法语回答他。

example.ex: He had never been able to make a reasonable living from his writing.
example.tran: 他一直没能靠写作过上舒适的生活。

value.def: A reasonable amount of something is a fairly large amount of it.

example.ex: They will need a reasonable amount of desk area and good light.
example.tran: 他们将需要一个面积较大的摆放办公桌的地方和充足的照明。

example.ex: From now on events moved reasonably quickly.
example.tran: 从此事情进展得相当快。
